text: Cytokine profile of human PBMC following a 48 h in vitro stimulation with LPS , <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , GP , GP + LPS and GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>

Because of the GP - induced band shifts to seven sites from the <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IFNgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoters , it could be assumed that GP treatment of human PBMC would lead to production of <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IFNgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and other pro-inflammatory mediators .
Previous studies reported that beta-1 to 3-D-glucans induced only a limited cytokine secretion of human blood cells [ 15-18 ] .

Corroborating and extending these singular findings in terms of examining pro - ( eight ) as well as anti - ( three ) inflammatory cytokines over time ( 48 h ) and six additional transcription factor binding sites , our comprehensive analysis revealed the following cytokine profile of human leukocytes in response to a highly purified water soluble beta-1 to 3-D-glucan and in comparison to two pro-inflammatory mediators ( LPS , <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) :
( i ) <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>
There was no <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production detectable following PBMC treatment with 1 nor 100 mug GP .
An insignificant up-regulation of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production for GP + LPS was observed in comparison with LPS .

For GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> we found a significant reduction in <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> from 18 h - 24 h , for the latter by about 40 % when compared to <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or the theoretical value of GP / <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> calc .

On the whole , GP mediated a reduction of the <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced amount of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by about 50 % ( Fig . 3A ) .
( ii ) <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>

GP induced only a small amount of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and there was no significant alteration of the LPS - induced <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by GP .

On the contrary , we observed a decreased <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production for GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> when compared to <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or GP / <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> calc . , especially at 24 h by about 40 % ( n = 5 ; both p = 0.02 ) , ( data not shown in detail ) .
( iii ) <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>
We found that GP induced a substantial <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production , in comparison with medium control , especially at 24 h ( n = 13 ; p < 0.01 ) .
A combination of GP and LPS resulted in a non-significant increase of <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production when compared to LPS or GP / LPS calc .

There was no significant alteration in <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production following GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> when compared to <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or GP / <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> calc .
( data not shown in detail ) .
( iv ) <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>

Besides <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was the only mediator which was produced in significant quantities following GP treatment , especially at 24 h ( n = 14 , p < 0.01 ) .
When compared to LPS stimulation or GP / LPS calc . , GP + LPS did not alter the kinetic course of the <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production .

However , following GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> we found a synergistic increase in <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production from 18 h to 48 h , when compared to <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( for instance at 24 h : n = 6 ; p = 0.01 ) or to the theoretical value of GP / <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> calc .
( from 18 h to 36 h ) .

Over the time course of 48 h , GP elevated the <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced amount of <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by approximately 200 % ( Fig . 3B ) .
Positive correlation between GP - induced <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> productions .
Following stimulation with GP ( 24 h ) , we observed a positive correlation between <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Moreover , we found this correlation to be dose - dependent , since 100 mug of GP induced larger amounts of <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-1RA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> than 1 mug GP ( n = 5 , p < = 0.002 , r = 0.9 and 0.98 , respectively ) .
( v ) <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>
With respect to <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production , 100 mug of GP yielded minor , statistically not distinguishable amounts , when compared to medium control .
GP + LPS did not change the <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production when compared to LPS supplementation or GP / LPS calc .

When combined with <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or GP / <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> calc . , GP seemed to exert a synergistic effect on <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> secretion after 36 h ( n = 3 ; p < 0.05 ) , but overall an enhancement of only 10 % was observed ( p > 0.05 ; data not shown in detail ) .
( vi ) <extra_id_0> IFNgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>
No <extra_id_0> IFNgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production was detectable following treatment of PBMC with 100 mug GP .

There was a minor increase in <extra_id_0> IFNgamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production following GP + LPS at 36 h , when compared to LPS or GP / LPS calc . , and a slight down-regulation following GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> at 24 h and 36 h , when compared to <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or GP / <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> calc .
( data not shown ) .

( vii ) <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-12 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> TGFbeta1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>

The production of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-12 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TGFbeta 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was not induced by GP .
There were also no significant differences between medium control , LPS , <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , GP , GP + LPS , GP / LPS calc .
and GP + <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or GP / <extra_id_0> TSST-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> calc .
over 48 h ( data not shown ) .
